alert.note: Alert for Chester; Decatur; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 12:41AM CST until February 16 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Chester, Decatur and Henderson. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1241 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parsons, Decaturville, Sardis, Reagan, Montgomery, Scotts Hill, Milledgeville, Enville, Taylors Crossing, Lick Skillet, Garrett, Haney, Red Walnut, Beacon, Wilkinstown, Largo, Mount Tabor, Mount Lebanon, Perryville and Roby. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
